name: 17th and 18th Century Philosophy
description: Classic texts by European philosophers (e.g., Hobbes, Descartes, Spinoza, Leibniz, Locke, Berkeley, Hume and Kant). Their attitudes toward science and religion, and their theories about the nature of the world and of human knowledge, culminating in the "Copernican Revolution" of Kant. [48L, 24T]
prerequisites: PHL101H5/ PHL102H5/ PHL103H5/ PHL105Y5/ PHL113H5 (may be taken as a corequisite) or 4.0 credits.
